{{Infobox quest |name = Six Angry Beasts |image = XC3 Challenge Battle Mode.png |description = "Do friends know monsters that get strong when angry? Point is to use Burst combo to cool heels!" |giver = [[Nopon Archsage]] |location = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |difficultyCB3= 3 |rewards = 300-450 [[Noponstone]]s (Easy)
600-900 [[Noponstone]]s (Normal) }} '''Six Angry Beasts''' is a Time Attack [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge Battle]] in {{XC3}}. It can be received from [[Nopon Archsage]] in the [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]], available as downloadable content from the second part of the Expansion Pass. Clearing this challenge with at least an A rank for the first time will unlock the Swimwear A outfit for [[Taion]]. == Challenge Rules == {| class="xc1" | Waves || 3 |- | Level Restriction || Lv 30 |} == Enemies == {| class="xc1" ! Wave ! Enemy ! Level |- | rowspan="2" | 1 || [[Plain Armu (XC3)|Plain Armu]] x1 || 32 |- | Plain Armu x2 || 30 |- | 2 || [[Massido Ardun (XC3)|Massido Ardun]] x2 || 32 |- | 3 || [[Costa Balgas]] x 1|| 33 |} [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battles]]

[[File:Cave Skeeter.png|thumb|A Cave Skeeter]] '''Skeeters''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|スキート}}, ''Sukīto'') are flying, mosquito-like enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are of a similar size to [[Flier]]s and [[Wisp]]s, and sometimes denoted '''Skeets'''.
== {{XC|-}} == In {{XC}}, Skeeters come in two colours.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Cave Skeeter (XC1)|Cave Skeeter]] * [[Chordy Skeeter]] * [[Leg Skeeter]] * [[Light Skeeter (XC1)|Light Skeeter]] * [[Little Skeeter]] * [[Medium Skeeter]] * [[Prom Skeeter (XC1)|Prom Skeeter]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Leg Skeeter]] * [[Light Skeeter (XC1)|Light Skeeter]]
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, Skeeters can be found in [[Gormott Province|Gormott]], [[Empire of Mor Ardain|Mor Ardain]], [[Temperantia]], and the [[Cliffs of Morytha]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Illumi Skeeter (XC2)|Illumi Skeeter]] * [[Linka Skeet]] * [[Mishgal Skeeter]] * [[Noog Skeeter (XC2)|Noog Skeeter]] * [[Yellow Skeeter]]
=== Challenge Battle Mode Enemies === * [[Lert Skeeter]] * [[Teode Skeeter]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Ers Skeeter]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Chattering Skeeter]] (Wisp model, during ''[[Sweetest Tidings]]'')
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Amity Skeeter]] * [[Baruka Skeeter]] * [[Cave Skeeter (XC3)|Cave Skeeter]] * [[Illumi Skeeter (XC3)|Illumi Skeeter]] * [[Kroda Skeeter]] * [[Light Skeeter (XC3)|Light Skeeter]] * [[Morsula Skeeter]] * [[Noog Skeeter (XC3)|Noog Skeeter]] * [[Prom Skeeter (XC3)|Prom Skeeter]] * [[Selurine Skeeter]] * [[Tezlan Skeeter]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Forin Skeeter]] (During ''[[I'm a Mechanic]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Altruistic Maribel]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Cave Skeeter (XC3)|Cave Skeeter]] * [[Kroda Skeeter]]
== Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === <gallery> Prom Skeeter.jpg Little Skeet.jpg </gallery>
=== {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> Linka Skeet.jpg|Linka Skeet Noog Skeeter.png|Noog Skeeter TeodeSkeeter.jpg|Teode Skeeter </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> ErsSkeeter.jpg|Ers Skeeter ChatteringSkeeter.jpg|Chattering Skeeter (Wisp model) </gallery>

revision.text:
[[file:KallasSkwaror.jpg|thumb|Kallas Skwaror]] '''Skwarors''' are dinosaur-like enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}, first appearing in {{XC2}}. They are small creatures similar to [[wikipedia:Dromaeosauridae|dromaeosaurids]]. This species is close to [[Rapchor]] but Skwarors have a denser plumage and come in two varieties, blue or black in color. A few named '''runners''' are used as scouts but this term can be used for other species.
== {{XC2|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Igard Skwaror]] * [[Karlin Skwaror]] * [[Koror Skwaror]] * [[Makfur Runner]] * [[Meldl Skwaror]] * [[Melz Runner]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Kallas Skwaror (XC2)|Kallas Skwaror]] (During ''[[One Step Ahead]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Cunning Saggie]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Kanoo Skwaror]]
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Avee Skwaror]] * [[Chadol Skwaror]] * [[Kallas Skwaror (XC3)|Kallas Skwaror]] * [[Kokto Skwaror]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Alaat Skwaror]] (During ''[[Learning from Lambda]]'') * [[Disparre Skwaror]] (DLC, during ''[[Champion of the Nopon]]'') * [[Hungry Skwaror]] (During ''[[The Harvest]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Scornful Daria]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Avee Skwaror]] * [[Dark Skwaror]] ([[Fogbeast]]) * [[Kallas Skwaror (XC3)|Kallas Skwaror]]
== Notes == * The [[Karlin Skwaror]] from {{XC2|-}} mistakenly resemble a Rapchor instead of a Skwaror.
== Etymology == Skwaror name may be a reference to [[wikipedia:Halszkaraptor|halszkaraptors]], waterfowl-like [[wikipedia:Dromaeosauridae|Dromaeosauridae]] dinosaurs.
== Gallery == === {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> Cunning-Saggie-portrait.jpg|Cunning Saggie Meldl Skwaror.jpg|Meldl Skwaror </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> KanooSkwaror.jpg|Kanoo Skwaror </gallery>
=== {{XC3|-}} === <gallery> Alaat Skwaror.png|Alaat Skwaror XC3 Disparre Skwaror.png|Disparre Skwaror Kallas Skwaror (XC3).jpg|Kallas Skwaror Scornful Daria.png|Scornful Daria </gallery>
=== {{XC3FR|sub}} === <gallery> Dark Skwaror.jpg|Dark Skwaror </gallery>

|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Slashing Weapon Belt |image = XC3 Accessory Belt.png |caption = Boost damage dealt to Aquatic Life by 50%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 750 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Slashing Weapon Belt |image = XC3 Accessory Belt.png |caption = Boost damage dealt to Aquatic Life by 55%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 750 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Slashing Weapon Belt |image = XC3 Accessory Belt.png |caption = Boost damage dealt to Aquatic Life by 60%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 750 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Slashing Weapon Belts''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

{{for|other uses|Sleep}} {{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Sleep |caption = Incapacitates until damage is taken. |image = XC3 Sleep Icon.png |type = Debuff |attribute = Ether |base-duration = 20.0s |max-duration = 30.0s |success-rate = 60% |rng-applicable = Yes }} '''Sleep''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. It prevents the affected character from acting until the debuff ends or they take damage. It has a long recovery animation for humanoid targets, making it much more effective on enemies such as [[Keves]]i and [[Agnus|Agnian]] troops. Similarly, it will incapacitate party members for several seconds even after the effect timer has ended.
The [[Divining Hairgrip]] and [[Four Sea Hairgrip]] have a high chance to prevent Sleep from being removed on the enemy whenever the user lands an auto-attack or an Art, respectively. Similar accessories can be [[Craft Accessories|crafted]] with the same effect.
== Distribution == === Arts === * [[Dark Banner]] ([[Tactician]])
==== {{XC3FR|sub}} ==== * [[Lightning Bash]] ([[Na'el]])
[[Category:XC3 Status]] [[Category:XC3FR Status]]
{{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}}

{{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Slow Recharge |caption = Reduces rate of recharge. |image = XC3 Slow Recharge.png |type = Debuff |attribute = Ether |base-duration = 15.0s |max-duration = 22.5s |success-rate = 60% |rng-applicable = No |effect-title-1 = Base Recharge Reduction |effect-value-1 = 25% }} '''Slow Recharge''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. It reduces the character's recharge rate; Keves (and enemy) cooldown timers will tick slower, Agnus arts will gain less charge per auto-attack or Art cancel, and Talent Arts will gain less charge upon a Role Action.
== Distribution == === Arts === *[[Rigid Slicer]] ([[Lapidarist]]) *[[Solid Silver]] ([[Masha]])
===Enemy-only Arts=== *Grenade Launch ([[Puzzling Special Unit]], [[Keves Deathsapper]]) *Gravity Catastrophe ([[Z∞]])
[[Category:XC3 Status]] [[Category:XC3FR Status]]
{{fr stub}}

|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Smart Protector |image = XC3 Accessory Boot.png |caption = Boosts Block Rate by 35% when HP is at 30% or lower. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 4840 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Smart Protector |image = XC3 Accessory Boot.png |caption = Boosts Block Rate by 36% when HP is at 30% or lower. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 4840 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Smart Protector |image = XC3 Accessory Boot.png |caption = Boosts Block Rate by 37% when HP is at 30% or lower. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 4840 [[Gold|G]] }}

revision.comment: added master art tag to Mighty Beat for ease of reference
revision.text:
{{for|the status in {{XC2|-}}|Smash (XC2)}} [[File:XC3 Smash Icon.png|thumb|Smash Icon]] '''Smash''' is a status in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. It causes a [[Launch (XC3)|Launched]] target to be smacked down to the ground, inflicting massive damage. It also has the unique effect of moving an enemy’s rage marker to the right, making them [[Enraged|Enrage]] faster. Smash is instantaneous.
== Smash-inflicting Arts == * [[Saber Strike]] ([[Flash Fencer]]) * [[Mighty Beat (XC3)|Mighty Beat]] ([[Lost Vanguard]], Master Art) * [[Sumo Press]] ([[Soulhacker|Soul Hacker]]) * [[Rolling Smash (XC3)|Rolling Smash]] ([[Noah]], [[Ouroboros]]) * [[Wing Smash (XC3)|Wing Smash]] ([[Sena]], [[Ouroboros]]) * [[Final Lucky Seven]] ([[Noah]] Only) * [[Gravity Blow]] (Noah Only)
{{Xc3 stub}}
[[Category:XC3 Status]] [[Category:XC3FR Status]]

{{for|the Accessory in {{XC2|-}}|Smithy Gloves (XC2)}}
|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Smithy Gloves |image = XC3 Accessory Gauntlet.png |caption = Boosts accuracy by 4% each time an enemy evades an attack (up to a maximum of 50%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 12,240 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Smithy Gloves |image = XC3 Accessory Gauntlet.png |caption = Boosts accuracy by 4.5% each time an enemy evades an attack (up to a maximum of 50%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 12,240 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Smithy Gloves |image = XC3 Accessory Gauntlet.png |caption = Boosts accuracy by 5% each time an enemy evades an attack (up to a maximum of 50%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 12,240 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Smithy Gloves''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]
